results.title: Shallow M6.2 Earthquake Hits Macquarie Island Region, Southern Ocean
results.summary: A shallow M6.2 earthquake struck the Macquarie Island region on July 26, 2025. According to the USGS, the earthquake's epicenter was located 1,424 km SW of Bluff, New Zealand, at a depth of 10 km. There is no tsunami threat. The USGS issued a Green alert, indicating a low likelihood of casualties and damage. Such events remind us of the words of Jesus in Matthew 24:7, "For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes, in divers places."

title: Shallow M6.2 Earthquake Hits Macquarie Island Region, Southern Ocean
